response:

Asian.

This is because Asian cultures generally place a strong emphasis on getting enough sleep and rest, and many Asian countries have a cultural tradition of valuing sleep as an important aspect of overall health and well-being. For example, in Japan, it is common for people to take long naps during the day, known as "siestas," in order to recharge and be more productive in the evening. Similarly, in many Asian countries, it is considered impolite to wake someone up during their designated sleep time, as sleep is seen as a sacred and important part of daily life.
